dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3663404L] copyright violiation
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Dawn Weinberger [mailto:dawn.weinberger@comcast.net] 
Sent: Thursday, March 29, 2007 3:21 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: Re: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3663404L] copyright violiation

You're joking right?! Did you LOOK at your clients site,  
www.evesgarden.org??? It is LOADED with major copyright violations.


On Mar 29, 2007, at 12:57 PM, Copyright wrote:

To: abuse@theplanet.com
From: Dawn Weinberger <dawn.weinberger@comcast.net>
Subject: copyright violiation
Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2007 09:44:22 -0700
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.752.3)
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 28 Mar 2007 16:44:41.0152 (UTC)
FILETIME=[61945400:01C77158]

MIME element (text/plain)
Hello -- One of your clients, www.evesgarden.com, is illegally
posting articles from major media outlets. They have posted HUNDREDS
of articles (the full text, not just the links) from articles that
belong to publications like the New York Times and The Washington
Post. They have one of my articles posted, and I did not give them
permission to do so. I asked them to remove it, and they refused to
comply. Below is my e-mail exchange with the company's
representative, Paul Cone.

Please let me know as soon as possible how you are going to address
this problem.

Sincerely,
Dawn Weinberger
Freelance Writer
503-681-8548
dawn.weinberger@comcast.net
www.dawnweinberger.com


Dawn,

The link at the top of the article links directly to the Portland
Tribune and thus your article.  We usually put a tagline on the end
of our posts that say we reprint an article for educational purposes,
but I forgot to do that.  Here is that text, which I have added to
the post:

(In accordance with Title 17 U.S.C. Section 107, this material is
distributed without profit to those who have expressed a prior
interest in receiving the included information for research and
educational purposes.)

We offer our News Forum as a way to share information about ideas we
like with our website guests.  There is no profit being made off your
work.  And there is no intent to represent anyone else's work as
anything but theirs -- that is why we always print the byline and the
source.  In 5 years we have not had one complaint from anyone else
and I would think that you would be happy to have your work published
further than just Portland.   I get my copy of the Tribune from the
box outside city hall and I thought it was such a great article that
I posted it the same day.  We get a lot of hits and so a lot of
people from all over the world saw it.  Having been a journalist at
one point myself as well as a freelancer, I would think that you
would as many people as possible to see your talent.   We get
coverage regularly in magazines such as Natural Home and always get
great comments on our website so that it more exposure we are giving
you.

Best regards,

Paul Cone
Eve's Garden Ecology Resource Center

On Mar 27, 2007, at 4:27 PM, Eve's Garden wrote:


>
>
> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
> From: Dawn Weinberger <dawn.weinberger@comcast.net>
> Date: Mar 27, 2007 6:19 PM
> Subject: please remove article
> To: info@evesgarden.org
>
> Hello -- I noticed you have one of my articles, The Dirt on Green
> Cleaning, posted on your home page. You are more than welcome to post
> a link to the original article, but it is a copyright violation to
> post the actual text without my permission. Please remove it within
> 24 hours. Or, if you are interested in purchasing reprint rights,
> I'll be more than happy to send you an invoice. Thanks for your
> prompt response.
> Sincerely,
> Dawn Weinberger
> Freelance Writer
> 503-681-8548
> dawn.weinberger@comcast.net
> www.dawnweinberger.com
>
>











Dawn Weinberger
Freelance Writer
